Davaajav is a very hard-working and sensible businessman. He plans to build an apartment complex in the district near the colleges and rent the units to students or other people who need housing. Over the last several years, there has been a lot of population growth in the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Therefore, he needs to increase his income in order to have capital for his new business. Davaajav plans to start a taxi business to supplement the income from his current job by working at night and on his day off, but he does not have the money to purchase a car. He needs over MNT 3,000,000 to cover the cost of purchasing a car for his taxi business.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Mo'ammar

texts.en:
Mo'ammar is a 28-year-old man. He is married and has two sons and three daughters. He is a taxi driver who earns a low income. Mo'ammar wants to make some necessary repairs to his taxi such as painting, changing the engine, changing the doors, etc. However, the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for this, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Mo'ammar gets the loan, he will pay the expenses for making repairs to his taxi. This will improve the taxi conditions and enable Mo'ammar to work extra hours and take more requests. This will allow him to increase his income and create better living conditions for his family. Mo'ammar is photographed next to his taxi.


About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see for the fund-raising includes both the principal loan and the loan-servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending help text: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to make some repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 40-year-old man, and a father of 4 sons and daughters.

Adel started his own business 7 years ago selling sanitary napkins and tools, and through these years he has been able to expand the shop space and add a few more products such as cosmetics to sell in his store. Now he has applied for a loan to enhance the products that he sells in the store by bringing in better quality cosmetics and perfumes too.

loans.use: To add more cosmetics and perfumes to his inventory

loans.name: Amil

texts.ru: Amil yavlyayetsya IDP personom i pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Amil 50 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Uje 7 let kak on rabotayet taxistom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy bil toje taxistom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi klupit zapchasti dlya pochinki svoyey mashini. Yego deti uchatsya v kolledje.
texts.en: Amil is an international displaced person and a refuge from the city of Fuzuli. He now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. Amil is 50 years old. He is married and has two children. His children are attending college. For the last seven years he has been working as a taxi driver. He has inherited this business from his father who was also a taxi driver. Currently Amil needs a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy spare parts to repair his car.

loans.use: to purchase car spare parts

loans.name: Vazirkhan

texts.en: Vazirkhan is a 54-year-old man who is married and has five children. He has been running his business for the past eight years, and he earns about 250 AZN per month. Vazirkhan sells fruits and vegetables in the local bazaar. He plans to use this loan in the amount of 1000 AZN to invest in his business. Vazirkhan hopes to invest in the purchase of additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. His goal is to expand his business and provide a prosperous lifestyle for his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and young crops.

loans.name: İlkin

texts.en: Ilkin is a 31-year-old man living in Agsu with his family. He is blessed with two children. Ilkin's wife takes care of the children and helps him with his business. He has an established grocery store, which he has run for the last eight years. The business is the only source of income for the young family. Ilkin is a diligent man who has plans and dreams for the future. With the help of AqroInvest and Kiva, he has requested a loan in the amount of 1500 AZN to increase his inventory and enlarge the store. This is his second loan and he has a good loan history.

loans.use: to increase his store's inventory.

loans.name: Balakhan

texts.en: Balakhan is married and lives with his wife and four children in Agsu, a province of Azerbaijan. His wife does the household chores and takes care of their children. In 2005, Balakhan decided to open a home goods store. When he started operating his business, he had much less working capital than he does now, after years of successful operation. Balakhan's trading business has grown thanks to his first loan with AqroInvest in 2010. He has a good loan history. Nowadays his monthly income is around 250 AZN. After successfully repaying his previous loans, he has requested a fourth loan in the amount of 1500 AZN to provide working capital to purchase more merchandise. Balakhan and his family are very thankful to AqroInvest and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik is a 56-year-old man. He is married and has two sons. Malik has owned and managed a grocery store for the last ten years. His store is located at the front of his house, and his wife actively helps him in his trading business. They are very hard-working people. By expanding the business he will be able to improve his family's quality of life. Malik feels happy because this is his fourth loan from AqroInvest and Kiva. He has requested a loan in the amount of 1800 AZN to renovate his store and expand his inventory.

loans.use: to renovate his store and expand his inventory.

loans.name: Shahid

texts.en: Shahid is from Agsu city. He is a 55-year-old married man and is blessed with two sons. Shahid's main goal is to provide a better life for his family. His wife helps him with it. They are a very diligent family. To make a better living, in 2006 Shahid opened an electrical goods store. After the first loan taken out from AqroInvest and Kiva in 2009, the income of the family increased up to 400 AZN per month. Shahid is very thankful for the support given to him. With the help of this fifth loan in the amount of 1800 AZN, Shahid purchased stock for his store. After he repays this loan, he plans to apply for more loans to grow his business and to enlarge the store.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his electrical goods store

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan is a 32-year-old trader who sells different kinds of foodstuffs. Elshan is married and has a son. He started his business in 2008 and since that time he has gained respect among the local people. The demand for foodstuffs is very high and he is not able to meet it. He needs to buy additional food products to increase his income. That is why he requested his second loan from AqroInvest. Elshan plans to use the loan of 1500 AZN to expand his inventory.

loans.use: to expand inventory

loans.name: Ceyhun

texts.en: Ceyhun is a 26-year-old man who lives in the city of Agsu. He is single and lives with his parents. Ceyhun is an owner of a food-stuffs store. His father helps him in his business. This is the first loan Ceyhun received from Aqroinvest and Kiva. Ceyhun used this loan of 1000 AZN to buy more goods to sell in his store to increase sales. His business is the only source of income for his family. Ceyhun plans to open another store in the future.

loans.use: to buy inventory for store

loans.name: Agamir

texts.en: Agamir is a 34-year-old man, who lives with his family in a small settlement in Agsu. He has a son who is 13 years old. Agamir decided to start his own business in 2007 and since that time has done well. This is his first loan with Aqroinvest and Kiva. He used this loan of 1000 AZN to purchase stock for his store. Agamir sells fruits and vegetables. He dreams to increase the family income which now is only 250 AZN per month. Agamir is a diligent man, who after repaying this loan, plans to open a new store.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his fruits and vegetables store

loans.name: Mutallim

texts.en:
Mutallim is a 53 year-old married man with two children. He is from Agsu. Mutallim and operates a gardening business to earn his living. He's been in this line of work for 18 years and he earns about 260 AZN a month. 

He requested a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

This is his first loan from AqroInvest.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en:
Nadir is a hard-working, entrepreneur from Agsu city.  Ten years ago he decided to open a small grocery sales business.  Today, his business is successful and he is looking to expand. 

Nadir has requested a loan of 1800 AZN to purchase additional foodstuff for his grocery.  He plans to increase the variety of items he has available for customers.

Nadir is married and has two sons.  One of his goals for his business is to help his children all he can.

loans.use: to purchase additional foodstuff.

loans.name: Shahlar

texts.en:
Shahlar is a 54 year-old father of four children.  He is a strong, hard-working man with a healthy appetite for learning and big plans for the future. 

Over the past six years, he has gained experience selling various items such as souvenirs, school bags, toys, etc.  

Shahlar has been a member of the AqroInvest credit Union since 2010.  This is his second loan from AqroInvest and the loans help him stock his small general store where he works all day. 

With this loan, in amount of 1500 AZN, he will stock his store with various items. Thanks to the loans he continues to increase his sales.

loans.use: to stock store with various items.

loans.name: Cristobal Alfides

texts.es:
El señor Cristóbal tiene 58 años de edad, es casado con cinco hijos, pero solo uno vive con él.   

Él se dedica a prestar sus servicios como albañil, ya tiene más de 30 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, fueron unos amigos quienes le enseñaron. Además él junto con su esposa tiene un negocio de venta de plásticos desde hace 6 años. Su inventario es de 10 docenas de platos pachos, 5 docenas de platos soperos, 10 docenas de huacales de diferentes tamaños, 2 docenas de mascones para lavar platos, 1 docena de coladores de aluminio, 2 docenas de toallas para usar en la cocina y 2 docenas de manteles.

Esta mercancía las compra en una ciudad del oriente del país, que se encuentra a 27 kilómetros de la ciudad donde vive él, ahí encuentra los plásticos a mejor precio. Cristóbal solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar 1 docena de rayadores plásticos, 6 docenas de escobas, 6 docenas de mascones de alambre, 6 docenas de coladores, 6 docenas de cucharones de teflón, 6 docenas de cubiertos, 6 docenas de platos de zinc, 6 docenas de cantaros, 20 botellas y cambiarle las llantas a su vehiculo y hacerle otras arreglos.

 De esta manera Cristóbal, incrementara su inventario y diversificara sus productos, por lo que ofrecerá más a sus clientes y satisfará la demanda existente, además que tendrá su vehiculo en buen estado.

De los ingresos que reciba, producto de la venta en su negocio, tiene pensado ahorrar para comprar un terreno y construir una casa, ya que donde viven es alquilada.
texts.en:
Cristobal, 58, is married with 5 children, but only one lives with him. He has worked as a mason for more than 30 years, and learned the trade from some friends. Together with his wife, he also opened a business 6 years ago selling plastic goods. His inventory is 10 dozen flat-brimmed plates, 5 dozen soup bowls, 10 dozen crates of various sizes, 2 dozen steel wool sponges for washing dishes, 1 dozen aluminum colanders, 2 dozen kitchen towels and 2 dozen tablecloths. He buys his merchandise in a city in the eastern part of the country, which is 27 kilometers from where he lives. He finds the plastic goods at a better price there.

Cristobal asks Fundacion Campo for a loan to buy 1 dozen plastic graters, 6 dozen brooms, 6 dozen steel wool sponges, 6 dozen colanders, 6 dozen Teflon ladles, 6 dozen pieces of cutlery, 6 dozen tin plates, 6 dozen pitchers, 20 bottles and to change the tires and make other repairs to his vehicle.

This will help Cristobal to increase and diversify his inventory so that he can offer more to his customers and satisfy the current demand. He will also have his vehicle in good working condition. 

From the income that he makes as a result of the sales, he wants to save money in order to buy some land and build a house, since they currently live in a rental home.

loans.use: to buy 12 plastic graters, 6 dozen brooms, 6 dozen steel wool sponges, 6 dozen colanders, 6 dozen Teflon ladles, 6 dozen pieces of cutlery, 6 dozen tin plates, 6 dozen pitchers, 20 bottles y to change the tires on his vehicle and make other repairs.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has three children.

Amer has owned a food market since 2003, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

Amer decided to apply for a loan of $2000 in order to redecorate his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to redecorate his market.

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. he is 49 years old, married and a father to five children.

Tamer has been the owner of a cars workshop since 2000. He repairs all types of cars. He HAS sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Tamer is requesting $3000 loan in order to renovate his shop’s walls and to increase the inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his shop’s walls and to increase the inventories.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 20 years old, married and has one child.

Alaa has been an owner for a food market since 2009. Selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products, he has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

Alaa has decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to make an outdoor ceiling and to renovate and redecorate his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make an outdoor ceiling and to renovate and redecorate his market.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
This borrower, from Iraq, is 20 years, single, and lives with eight family members, three of whom work. Youssef has had a barbershop since 2008 that offers hair cuts, shaves and beard- trimming. Well-known in the surrounding area, he is experienced in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumers.

Youssef is requesting a $3000 loan to make aluminum showcases and shelves and to purchase a barber chair and generator. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring growth.

loans.use: to make aluminum showcases and shelves and to purchase a barber chair and generator.

loans.name: Fakher

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married and has seven children.

Fakher is a grocer. In 2010 he opened his own store selling all kinds of vegetables and fruits. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumers. He is well known in the surrounding areas.

He has decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his store.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and lives with four family members.  Alaa has been the owner of the shop since 2006, selling women's accessories and scarves. He has been working in this field for more than six years ago and has a deep understanding of the local consumer and he is well known in the surrounding areas.  He is requesting an $1800 loan in order to redecorate his shop and to add more goods. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to redecorate his shop and to add more goods.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: This borrower is from Iraq. He is 21 years old, single and lives with seven family members and three of them also work.  Hussein has been an owner of the shop since 2008, selling auto electrical parts and accessories.  He has more than three years experience in this field, and a good reputation. His shop is located in an industrial area so there are a lot of customers passing by.  He decided to apply for an $1800 loan in order to renovate his shop and to make a sliding door. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to make a sliding door.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en: Sargis is engaged in agriculture. Unable to find sufficient financial means to cultivate the land, Sargis has applied for a loan. With the help of this loan Sargis will receive a good harvest next year and increase his income. This will allow him to make savings for further development of his agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for seeds

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein who is a 26-year-old young married man with one son, is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He also has a stall to sell cleaning materials which is a profitable venture that helps him to improve his income and create better living conditions for his family. Hussein has a shortage of some cleaning materials and does not have enough money to purchase them, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN to purchase the cleaning materials he needs. Taking this loan will enable Hussein to have a variety of cleaning materials in his stall. His costumers will be satisfied and his sales will increase and so will his income. Hussein is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase cleaning materials in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a conservative woman, so her husband, Hatem, is photographed instead in the FATEN branch office. 

Hiba, 28, is the mother of one son. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 
 
Hiba wants to make some repairs to their old house such as painting, changing tiles, installing lights, etc. in order to create better and more comfortable living conditions for her family. The amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for the repairs, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. 

Getting this loan will help Hiba to improve the condition of her old house by making the necessary repairs. This will enable Hiba to renew her old house and enjoy living with her family in better conditions.

loans.use: to pay for improving the condition of the family's house.

loans.name: Ra'ed

texts.en:
Ra'ed, who is a 26-year-old young man, is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Ra'ed has very old home furniture and he is looking to improve his house living conditions by getting new home furniture such as bedroom furniture, living room furniture, etc, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN to help him in paying. When Ra'ed gets the loan, he will be able to purchase new home furniture and offer to himself better and comfortable home conditions. Ra'ed is photographed in the picture.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Frankline

texts.en:
Frankline is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He is a tea dealer, a business he has run for eight years. He learned of Milango (Kiva lending partner) from other clients. Frankline is married and has eight children, only two of whom are still in school.

Frankline is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase a new stock of packed and blended tea. The main business challenge is the infiltration of substandard blended tea in the market. He would like to be an exporter of tea. Additional income from this loan will help him to pay school fees and to provide good health care to his children. He is full of praise about Milango and the role they play in impacting the society.

loans.use: to purchase a new stock of packed and blended tea.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a conservative woman, so her husband Khaled is photographed instead.

Mona is a 24-year-old young woman. She is married and has one son. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Mona wants to change the old refrigerator that doesn't preserve food well and also wants to get new bedroom furniture so that she and her son live in comfortable and healthy home conditions. Mona wants to take a loan from FATEN to complete the amount of money she has to pay. When she gets the loan, she will purchase new refrigerator for her kitchen and new bedroom furniture for her and her son. This will enable her to improve her family life and live in better conditions. 

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange, and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending help text: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for clothing to sell

loans.name: Valerik

texts.en:
Valerik is a 53-year-old entrepreneur from Khndzoresk village in the Syunik region. He lives with his wife and sister. Valerik's children live separately.
Valerik earns his living by breeding cattle and cultivating land. 

Valerik plans to increase the cattle. With the help of this loan, Valerik will purchase cattle and forage. Valerik hopes he will increase his income from the sales of milk and meat. Additional income will allow Valerik to help his children to live in improved conditions.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en: Andranik lives in Yerevan with his wife and three children. Andranik's wife is a school teacher and his three children are students. Andranik has run a little grocery for almost 5 years. Due to his hard work and enthusiasm, Andranik has managed to earn his living and sustain his family through these years. Now Andranik aims to develop his business. In order to meet the large demand for coffee, Andranik plans to purchase coffee stock in his grocery. This loan will help Andranik to increase his working capital and make savings to cover his children's educational costs.

loans.use: to pay for coffee

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad, who is a 22-year-old single man, has a store for selling electrical goods that provides his only source of income. Mohammad wants to expand his sales by purchasing some types of electrical goods that his customers demand, but that are not available in his store. He wants to fulfill these requests by combining some money he has with a loan from FATEN to purchase the products. Taking this loan will enable Mohammad to provide essential requested goods to his customers. This will satisfy his customers and increase his sales, allowing him to live in better conditions and secure a better future. Mohammad is photographed in his store.

loans.use: to purchase electrical goods that are not currently available in his store.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled, a 25-year-old single man, is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Khaled wants to improve his home living conditions by purchasing a new refrigerator. The old one has a cooling problem and doesn't preserve food well. Getting this loan from FATEN will enable Khaled to purchase a new refrigerator that will preserve his food safely, providing Khaled with better and healthier living conditions. Khaled is photographed in the picture.

About this loan:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a new home refrigerator.

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en: Ibrahem is a 32-year-old man with one son and two daughters. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Ibrahem lives in a new house and wants to purchase home appliances essential for every home, such as a refrigerator, stove, washing machine, etc. However, he does not have sufficient funds, so he needs to take a loan from Kiva partner, FATEN. Taking this loan will enable Ibrahem to purchase basic home appliances and offer his family better living conditions. Ibrahem is shown in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase essential home appliances.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a conservative woman, so her husband Naser is photographed instead. 

Sahar who is a 46 year old woman, is a mother of two sons and one daughter. Sahar's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Sahar lives in a new house and wants to purchase necessary home furniture such as: bedroom furniture, living room furniture, kitchen table, etc so that she can offer her family better home living conditions. Therefore, she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Sahar gets the loan, she will purchase the furniture she needs for her home. This will allow her family to live in comfortable home conditions.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.

Amal is a mother of two sons and two daughters all of whom are school students. Amal wants to complete the purchase of necessary home furniture such as: bedroom furniture for her children, dinning room furniture and living room seats so that she can offer her family better home living conditions. Yet, the amount of money she has isn't enough to buy these things, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. Getting this loan will enable Amal to purchase necessary home furniture that she doesn't have in her house which will offer her family better and comfortable living conditions at home. 

About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 30-year-old young man who is a father of one son and one daughter. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. To improve his income he works during the evening as a taxi driver, taking internal and external requests. 

Salah wants to own a taxi so he can work freely and increase his income.  To purchase the taxi, he needs to add to the amount of money he already has by getting a loan from FATEN. When Salah gets the loan, he will be able to purchase the taxi and work extra hours to increase his income and create better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi

loans.name: Deena

texts.en:
Deena is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.

Deena is a 29-year-old woman who is married and has two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Deena wants to change the old windows and doors in her house and install new ones so she can offer her family better home conditions, especially now that it is the winter season. 

Deena needs to take a loan from FATEN to pay.

loans.use: To pay for installing windows and doors for her house.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en: Akram is a 30-year-old single man. He is a taxi driver, which is his only source of income. Akram wants to increase the efficiency of his taxi by changing the old engine and purchasing a new one, so he needs to take a loan from Kiva partner FATEN to pay. When Akram gets the loan, he will be able to purchase a new engine for the taxi and increase its efficiency. Akram will work extra hours and take more internal and external requests to increase his income and have a better standard of living. Akram is shown in the picture. About this loan product FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for his taxi.

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is a 26-year-old man. Two years ago, he opened a store to sell soft drinks. This is his only source of income. Jalal wants to improve his store by painting and installing lights. He also wants to purchase a large quantity of different types of soft drinks to sell, so he will have a better assortment to sell and increase his income. 

Jalal needs to take out a loan from FATEN to cover the costs. When Jalal gets this loan, he will be able to make the necessary repairs to his store and purchase a collection of soft drinks to sell so his customers will have many choices when purchasing soft drinks. This will increase his sales and income so he can improve his living conditions.

Jalal is photographed in his store.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext.

loans.use: to purchase different types of soft drinks to resell and to make some improvements to the store.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman is a 32 year-old young man. He is married and is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary.  He also works as a taxi driver to increase his income. Ayman wants to improve the taxi conditions by making some necessary repairs to it.  He wants to change the tires, paint it, change doors, etc, but he doesn't have enough, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. Getting this loan will enable Ayman to pay the expenses needed to repair the taxi.  This will increase the taxi efficiency and conditions and enable him to work extra hours and take more requests so he can increase his income and offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: To make some repairs to the taxi

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil is 47 years old.  He is married and lives in the small village of Imishli. He has three children who are the apple of his eye. He is a cattle breeder. Kamil has 10 years of experience already in raising and selling cattle. During these years, Kamil has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. 

He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them and sells the meat in Imishli livestock bazaar.  Looking after cattle is hard and requires spending a lot of time in the open air. The climate is very severe, very hot in the summer and very cold in winter.  However, Kamil is not alone in his business, because his wife and elder son help to pasture and feed the animals. 

His monthly profit is 250 AZN. He wishes to expand his business to improve the life of his family. For this purpose, he applied for a 1000 AZN loan.  He will use this loan to purchase two cattle and fodder.  This will be his 3rd loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and fodder

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is a 33-year-old market vendor. He is married and has two children. Rovshan has sold food items, beverages, toiletries, detergents, and clothes for the last 10 years. During these years, Rovshan has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. He is a very friendly and polite person and has permanent clients who always come to Rovshan`s shop to buy something. His wife helps him sell his products.

His monthly profit is 230 AZN and he would like to increase it.  Of the products he sells, the most popular are clothes, and he would like to move in this direction and purchase more clothes for his shop. For this purpose he applied for a 1,000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for his shop

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en:
Eldaniz is 34 years old.  He is married and has two sons.  Eldaniz sells construction materials made of wood and steel. These kinds of materials are very popular for private house constructions and general buildings.  He has 10 years of experience in this field, which considers him a knowledgeable and skilled person.  His wife helps him to sell materials because the storehouse is located in his back yard. Eldaniz also raises fruits and vegetables in his garden and sells them in the bazaar.

His monthly profit from both his businesses is 320 AZN. He would like to expand both of them, and for this purpose he applied for 1400 AZN. He will spend 1000 AZN for buying additional materials and 400 AZN for seeds and fertilizers. Eldaniz  has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: purchase construction materials and seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Akif

texts.en:
Akif, a 53-year-old man, is married with three children. He sells construction materials wholesale. He has 12 years of experience in this field. Construction materials made of wood are quite expensive and, at the same time, are in high demand among local people. 
Akif's sales place is located in the central Saatli bazaar. Akif`s customers always come to Akif to buy materials, and he is always ready to make a discount. He serves people not only from his home city but also from neighboring villages and cities. 

Akif`s business brings in a stable income of 160 Azerbaijani manats (AZN). He applied for a 1400 AZN loan to purchase more materials and cover customers' demand. He has already demonstrated himself to be a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase materials to meet the market demand.

loans.name: Mnatsakan

texts.en: Mnatsakan lives in Shgharshik village with his wife, parents and child. He owns a lorry and provides transportation services, not only throughout the region, but also to other regions in Armenia. Besides transportation, Mnatsakan is also engaged in agriculture – he keeps cattle and cultivates land. Mnatsakan has applied for a loan as the wheels of the lorry are old and don't allow Mnatsakan to provide transportation effectively. With new wheels for the lorry, Mnatsakan will be able to increase his number of transports and get more income.

loans.use: to pay for wheels

loans.name: Argeshtin

texts.en: Argeshtin is a farmer from Sisian. He keeps cattle, beehives and an orchard. Argeshtin has been running his farm already for years and he has managed to build a barn for the cattle. Now Argeshtin would like to increase the number of cattle and develop his farm further. With the loan's help he will purchase five calves and forage. Argeshtin will get more income from the sales of milk and meat and this will provide improved living conditions for his family. Argeshtin lives with his wife, parents and three children.

loans.use: to pay for calves and forage.

loans.name: Sevada

texts.en: Sevada is a 32 year-old farmer and entrepreneur from Goris. He lives with his wife and little children. Sevada has been engaged in pig-breeding for many years. Due to his hard work Sevada has increased the number of pigs from one pig to four pigs and twenty-five young pigs. Sevada would like to expand his farm and get more income. With the requested loan he plans to purchase more pigs and forage. Besides agriculture Sevada also makes bread and sells it.  The additional income will allow him to make his dream come true and found his own bakery.

loans.use: to pay for pigs and forage.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen lives in Goris with his wife and daughter. He keeps a greenhouse. Armen has applied for a loan to develop his glasshouse. He plans to modernize it and make it more profitable. Arman also plans to purchase seeds to cultivate in the greenhouse and fuel. This loan will help Armen to increase the harvest and get more income from its sales. With additional income he will insure a sustainable life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a heating system, seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Qarib

texts.en:
Qarib is a 52-year-old man, who is married and has two sons. He sells fruits such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates and bananas. Fruits are very popular among Azerbaijani people and in high demand during the year. People like to eat them fresh and this is one of the main desserts for guests. Qarib has 7 years of experience in this field and has gained the necessary skills and knowledge required for his business. His shop is located in the central Agjabadi bazaar. People always pass his shop and come to buy some fresh fruits. His monthly income from this business is 200 Azerbaijani manats (AZN). 

Qarib wants to expand his business. The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover the high demand. He would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his turnover as well as to improve life for his family. For this reason, he applied for a 1000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is a 47-year-old married man with two adorable daughters. He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of food like candies, sausages, macaroni, tinned food and juices. These are the most popular products. Adil has 10 years of experience selling food and during these years he has gained the necessary experience and skills required for a successful business. His monthly income is 230 Azerbaijani manats (AZN). 

Adil would like to diversify and purchase more food merchandise. This will help to increase sales and improve living conditions for his family. He needs additional capital and for this purpose he applied for a 1000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase more food merchandise

loans.name: Nahid

texts.en:
Nahid is 26 years old and married. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  He sells different kinds of products. He sells foodstuffs like candies, cookies, butter, and macaroni as well as hair coloring and some cosmetics stuff. He has five years of experience in this field and gained the necessary skills and knowledge for business. 

The products he sells are very popular in Azerbaijan and sell out from his shelves. Nahid`s business brings him 300 AZN profit. It is hard to keep satisfied customers with this income, because Nahid needs to make some savings and can’t put all the income back into the business again. This is the only financial source for his family. 

He needs to expand his business and for this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN. He will use the loan to purchase more merchandise for his shop. This will be the third loan from AqroInvest CU to Nahid and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Kisilu

texts.en:
Kisilu lives in Changamwe, Kenya. His drive to grow his business made him join Milango to access credit. He is a married father of four school-going children. He owns a retail shop. Besides this business, Kisilu is also a farmer.
He is applying for a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock e.g. cereals, sugar, soap, bread, milk etc.
The main challenge Kisilu faces is high cost of most products and some clients not paying on time. He looks forward to owning a wholesale business.
Kisilu will use the extra income to provide for the family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock e.g. cereals, sugar, soap, bread, milk etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fuel wood and charcoal.

loans.name: Fariz

texts.en:
Fariz is a 36 year old young man. He is IDP and lives with his wife and one daughter in Bilasuavr IDP Settlement. He breeds cattle and has three years of experience in this field. 

Cattle breeding requires a lot of physical activity and Fariz spending most of the time in the open air. Pasturing takes 80% of Fariz`s time. He usually buys small calves, raises and fatten them for 5-6 months and then resells them for more profitable prices in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 200 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income for his family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. 

Fariz would like to purchase more cattle and for this purpose he applied for 1000 AZN. He needs this loan to increase monthly turnover and cover the needs of his customers.

loans.use: purchase two calves and fodder.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, who is a 39-year-old young man, is a father of three sons and one daughter. He is a taxi driver with a low income, which is the only source of income to him. 

Ahmad wants to change the taxi chairs, so he will be able to improve the taxi conditions and take more requests. So he needs to take a loan from FATEN. 

Taking this loan will enable Ahmad to purchase new chairs for the taxi, and that will improve its condition and enable Ahmad to work extra hours and take more requests. In this way, he will increase his income and be able to offer his family better living conditions. Ahmad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase new chairs for his taxi.

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en:
Khachatur is a 39-year-old farmer from Stepanavan. He keeps cattle. Khachatur lives with his parents, who help him to take care of the cattle. Besides cattle-breeding, Khachatur also drives a taxi. 

During more than twenty years of hard work Khachatur has created favorable conditions to develop his business, for which he needs some financial investments. With the help of this loan, Khachatur plans to purchase calves and increase the number of cattle. This will allow him to increase his income and develop beekeeping in the future.

loans.use: to pay for calves.

loans.name: Mayis

texts.en:
Mayis is a 43-year-old farmer from Tegh village. Mayis lives with his wife, daughter and parents. The family gets their main income from agriculture and it is barley enough to cover their daily costs. 

To increase the business income, Mayis plans to expand his farm. With the help of this loan he will purchase livestock. Mayis hopes the expansion of the farm will allow him to get more income from the sale of meat and milk. This is vital for Mayis as he will be able to pay for his daughter's education and insure a stable future for her.

loans.use: to pay for livestock.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot lives in Ashnak village with his wife, mother and children. Ashot works as a constructor, but unfortunately his salary is too low to meet his family's needs. So, Ashot also keeps cattle and cultivates land. 

He has applied for this loan to develop cattle-breeding. With the loan's help he plans to purchase a cow and forage. Ashot hopes to get more income from agriculture and develop his business further.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage

loans.name: Lyova

texts.en:
Lyova lives in Stepanavan. He is engaged in cattle breeding. Due to his hard work over ten years, Lyova has developed his farm and now wants to expand it. 

With the requested loan Lyova plans to purchase two calves and forage. The increase in cattle will allow Lyova to generate more income and help his children, who live separately. Lyova also hopes to create more favorable conditions for the cattle during winter by renovating the barn roof.

loans.use: to pay for calves and forage

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun lives with his wife and daughter. The family earns its living mainly from agriculture by breeding cattle and cultivating land. The current income Harutyun gets is barely enough to cover daily costs. This does not allow Harutyun to generate savings to invest in agriculture.

Thus, Harutyun has applied for a loan. With the loan Harutyun will purchase seeds to cultivate the land and forage for the cattle. Harutyun will keep his farm stable and develop it in the future.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and forage

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en:
Artyom is engaged in farming. He grows trees and plants in his greenhouse. Artyom lives with his wife, parents, brother and two children. Additional income is vital for Artyom and his family, as it will ensure improved living conditions for them. 

The development of his farming business will allow Artyom to harvest more in a few years and increase the income from its sales. Artyom needs some financial investment to develop his greenhouse. With the requested loan he plans to purchase fertilizer and saplings to plant.

loans.use: to pay for saplings and fertilizer

loans.name: Ra'ed

texts.en:
Ra'ed, who is a 33-year-old young man, is the father of one daughter and is a bank employee with a decent salary. He wants to improve his family's living conditions by purchasing new living room furniture and a new television, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN.

By getting this loan, it will enable Ra'ed to provide new living room furniture and a new television for his house, and will enable him to create better home living conditions for his family. Ra'ed is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase new living room furniture and a new television

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a secondhand clothes dealer in Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has 3 children. The business has been running for 3 years. He was introduced to Milango by his friends.

Patrick is applying for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy more clothes to sell. His main challenge is the high cost of clothes and finding customers during low season. Patrick intends to open a new clothes shop in Mombasa town. He will save the extra income obtained from the business for the family’s future needs.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Joash

texts.en:
Joash is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has three children. Joash has been running a real estate agency business for four years.

Joash is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a photocopier and stationery for a new business he is starting. He aspires to have his own property in the future. The challenge in this business is some clients not paying their bills on time. He will use the extra income from this loan to purchase other office machines.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopier and stationery.

loans.name: Adiyased

texts.en:
Adiyased, aged 48, is a businessman who runs two businesses together. He lives with his two sons and his wife in a house which is owned by one of his relatives. One of his businesses is as a meat seller at the bazaar and the other one is as a transportation driver using his minivan when he has no sales. 

Over many years, he has been saving money from his businesses to purchase necessary land for his private needs. But he is still lacking a little bit of money to cover the land payment. This purchase is absolutely important and a vital thing for his family. Therefore he is taking out a loan to use as additional funding to purchase the necessary land for his family. Before, he has taken out loans twice and repaid both successfully on time.

loans.use: To purchase necessary land for his family.

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married and has four children.

Kazem has been the owner of a food market since 2007, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is located in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan to purchase fridges and to make a sliding door and showcases for his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase fridges and to make a sliding door and showcases

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married and has one child.

Kareem has owned a barber shop since 2009, where he offers shaving and massage services. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is located in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop and to make a crystal showcase. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to make a crystal showcase

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, single and lives with two family members.

Since 2008, Kassem has owned a shop where he sells and repairs tires and wheels. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is located in a crowded area so there are a lot of people passing by.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to purchase an air pressure tire pump and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase an air pressure tire pump and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Abdel Hasan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married, and has five children.

Abdel Hasan has owned a food market since 2010, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese, and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, and he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there is a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $1800 in order to purchase a generator and refrigerators and to install a sliding door. He aims to gain more profits in order to have the opportunity to provide a better life for his entire family.

loans.use: to purchase a generator and refrigerators and to install a sliding door.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, divorced, and has one child.

Since 2007, Amer has owned a cafeteria, where he offers a variety of food for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His café is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot of people passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2700 loan to purchase a generator and two refrigerators for his cafeteria. He aims to gain more profits in order to have the opportunity to provide a better life for his entire family.

loans.use: to purchase a generator and two refrigerators for his cafeteria.

loans.name: No'man

texts.en: No'man is a 27-year-old single man. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. No'man wants to purchase a new computer to enhance his skills and to research different topics he is interested in. Because he doesn't have enough money, he needs to take a loan from FATEN. Getting this loan will enable No'man to have a new computer that will assist him in many useful fields and enhance his technical skills. It will allow him to acquire knowledge of new developments around him more easily. No'man is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a new computer for personal use.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married, and has two children.

Since 2008, Mohamad has had a shop where he sells lighting, electrical supplies, wire, and cables. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to renovate his shop and to install a sliding door. He aims to gain more profits, which would offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his entire family.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to install a sliding door.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 21 years old, single, and lives with eight family members. 

Ali has owned a workshop since 2007, where he fixes and repairs all kinds of cars. He has more than four years experience in this field, a good reputation, and is well known in his area. 

He decided to apply for a $2700 loan in order to buy the shop next to him. He aims to make more money to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy the shop next to him.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old and single.

Abbass has been the owner of a grocery store since 2006. He has a deep understanding of local consumers and he has a good reputation. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for $3,000 to buy a generator for his shop and tricycle to transport the goods. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To buy a generator for his shop and tricycle to transport his goods

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has six children.

Jawad has been the owner of an air conditioning and refrigerator repair workshop since 2000. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation; he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to rent a new shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to rent a new shop

loans.name: Abed Aoun

texts.en:
This borrower is 54-years-old, married and has one child. He lives with four family members.

Abed has been an owner of a food market since 2003. He sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he has a sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $1500 loan in order to purchase two fridges and to make additional shelves. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase two fridges and to make additional shelves.

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single and lives with six family members.

Karar has owned a barber shop since 2009, where he offers shaving and massage services. He has sufficient experience and has a good reputation. His shop is located in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to renovate his shop and to purchase an additional barber chair. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to purchase an additional barber chair

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and has two children.

Haydar has had a barber shop since 2003, where he offers shaving and massage services. He has sufficient experience and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 32-year-old man, the father of one son. He is a taxi driver with a low income. He decided to increase his income by purchasing the taxi he drives. As his own boss, he can work freely, taking on extra hours and additional internal and external requests. He needs to take a loan from FATEN to supplement the money he has in order to pay for the taxi. Getting this loan will allow Mohammad to work independently, enabling him to work extra hours and therefore to increase his income and provide his family with better living conditions. Mohammad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 30-year-old single young man. He is a taxi driver with low income, and he is looking to increase his income by purchasing the taxi he drives so it will be his own so he can work freely and for extra hours. 

He needs to take a loan from FATEN to complete the amount he has. Getting this loan will allow Nader purchase the taxi which will become his own and that will enable him to work for extra hours and increase his income and create better living conditions for himself. Nader is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to finish purchasing a taxi

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel, who is from Iraq, is 33 years old and married. The owner of a food market since 2009, he sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products. Kamel has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, and his market is situated in a crowded area with a good number of customers passing by.

Kamel is requesting a loan of $2400 to purchase two showcases and a generator and to construct a sliding door. He is striving to earn more profits in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase two showcases and a generator and to make a sliding door.

loans.name: Abdel Rahman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old and married.

Abdel Rahman has been the owner of a shop since 2005, selling mobile phones, recharge cards and phone accessories. He has sufficient experience and has a good reputation. His shop is located in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan to purchase a machine for repairing mobile phones and to add more stock. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for repairing mobile phones and to add more stock

loans.name: Issam

texts.en:
Issam, who is a 45-year-old man, is the father of two sons and five daughters. He is an employee with a decent salary.

Issam wants to purchase necessary home furniture since he has a large number of family members.  He wants items such as bedroom furniture for his children, living room furniture, etc., so he needs to take a loan from FATEN to pay. When Issam gets the loan, he will be able to purchase new home furniture and create for his family better and more comfortable home living conditions. Issam is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Margo

texts.en: Margo trades in clothing from a rented booth in the city market. Margo has applied for a loan to increase the variety of clothing. This loan will help Margo to increase sales and get more income. The latter will allow her to insure improved living conditions for her family. Margo lives with her son and daughter.

loans.use: to buy more clothing

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen is a farmer from Meghri. He keeps cattle. Armen lives with his wife and two children. He is the only breadwinner in the family and the current income he gets is not enough to save and invest in agriculture. Armen wants to increase the number of livestock and develop his farm. With the help of this loan, Armen plans to purchase livestock and forage. This will allow him to get additional income and develop agriculture in the future.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage

loans.name: Mher

texts.en: Mher lives in Mulki village with his wife, two children and father. He is engaged in cattle breeding and farming. Mher needs some financial investments to increase the cattle and develop his farm. Mher plans to purchase cattle and forage. This loan will help Mher to get more income from agriculture and make his farm more stable and profitable.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage

loans.name: Guloglan

texts.en:
Guloglan is 36 years old and married with two sons. He breeds cattle and sells them for meat purposes. He also breeds cows and sells milk and milk products. He has five years of experience, which makes him a knowledgeable and skilled person.

He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them and then resells them in the livestock bazaar for meat purposes.  Looking after cattle is hard and requires spending a lot of time in the open air. The climate is very severe. It is very hot in the summer and very cold in winter.  However, Guloglan is not alone in his business. His wife helps to pasture and feed the animals. 

Meat and milk products are most popular products in Azerbaijan. People drink fresh milk and homemade yoghurt everyday and consider it very healthy. Every national dish consists of meat like pilau and dolma. 

His monthly profit is 320 AZN. He wishes to expand his business to improve the life of his family. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1,800 AZN.  He will use this loan to purchase two cattle and fodder.  He has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder

loans.name: Alovsat

texts.en:
Alovsat is 52 years old and married with three children. He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of food products like macaroni, rice, butter, pickled vegetables and beverages. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field, which makes him a knowledgeable and skilled person. 

Alovsat`s business is growing fast and the products he sells are very popular in the everyday life of people. His monthly profit is 250 AZN.  He is not alone in his business and his wife helps him to sell products. 

Alovsat can’t cover his customers' demands because his profit is not enough for effective turnover.  He needs additional capital to invest in his shop. He applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase more food products and increase his sales. He has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more food products to sell

loans.name: Salomon

texts.es:
El señor Salomon, sigue manteniendo su negocio de pulperia, en donde administra junto a su esposa el negocio, ha sido un proceso de crecimiento, gracias a los prestamos que obtenido con la institucion. Para ambos la mejora a su vivienda es esencial, solo que van en parte, y  asi no descuidar el negocio.
Con su credito anterior logro un anexo de su cuarto, ahora podra invertir en la compra de granos basicos, golosinas, productos lacteos, jugos, gaseosas, siendo productos mas comprados por sus clientes. Manteniendo la variedad y precios accesibles a su clientela.
texts.en:
Mr. Salomon continues running his general store, which he does together with his wife.  This has been a growing process thanks to the loans that he has received from the institution.  For both of them improving their home is essential, which they are doing step by step in order not to neglect their business.
With their previous loan they added a room to the house.  This time he will be able to invest in the purchase of basic grains, candies, dairy products, juices, sodas, these being the products bought more often by the customers.  This will maintain the variety and affordable prices for their customers.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of basic grains to increase the sales of his market.

loans.name: Alim

texts.en:
Alim is 55 years old and married with five sons and one daughter. He sells food products such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop.  Alim has more than 20 years of experience in this field, which makes him a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 300 AZN. His wife helps him to sell products in the shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location in the central bazaar in his home city.

Alim would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1,800 AZN. He will purchase and diversify additional foodstuffs. This will be his third loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Amrulla

texts.en:
Amrulla is 57 years old and married with three children. He has raised and sold fruits and vegetables for the last 15 years. He is a very experienced farmer with deep knowledge of his business. He also works as a technical master and works on customers’ orders. This job is not profitable and is temporary.

Amrulla usually raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for a profitable price in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Also, one of the favorite national dishes, Dolma, is made of fresh eggplants, peppers and tomatoes. His monthly income from this business is 350 AZN.

Now Amrulla would like to invest more capital in his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1800 AZN. This will be his third loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Emil

texts.en:
Emil is 30 and married with two children. He raises fruits and vegetables in his garden and has been doing it for the last five years. He is a very experienced farmer and has deep knowledge of his land and how to operate it. 

Emil usually raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for a profitable price in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Also, one of the favorite national dishes, Dolma, is made of fresh eggplants, peppers and tomatoes. His monthly income from this business is 250 AZN. This is the only source of income in his family.

Now Emil would like to invest more capital in his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. This is the only source of income in his family and hopes this loan will improve the life of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Hafiz

texts.en:
Hafiz is 45 years old and married with three children.  He sells food products such as macaroni, butter, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop.  Hafiz has 16 years of experience in this field, which makes him a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 120 AZN. His wife helps him to sell products in the shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location in the central bazaar of his home city.

The profit he earns is not enough to reinvest in the business and covering customer demands is suffering for this reason. Being only one source of income, his profit is used for family needs. Hafiz would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital in the business. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN. He will purchase and diversify additional foodstuffs. This will be his fourth loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Jhon Freddy

texts.es: El señor Jhon Fredy se quedó sin empleo, y con la necesidad de brindarle el sustento a su familia creó un granero en el municipio de Bello, al norte de la ciudad de Medellín, donde trabaja desde entonces. Con el trabajo del granero sostiene los gastos del hogar donde convive con su pareja y sus dos hijos.  A sus 40 años, Jhon Fredy sueña con comprar una moto en la que pueda realizar el servicio a domicilio de su granero, de modo que aumenten sus ventas y con mayores ingresos pueda mejorarle la calidad de vida a su pareja y sus dos hijos.
texts.en: Señor Jhon Fredy did not have a job, and since he needed to support his family, he set up a grocery store in the municipality of Bello, north of the city Medellín, where he has worked since then. With his work in the grocery store, he provides for the expenses of his household, where he lives with his wife and two children. At the age of 40, Jhon Fredy dreams of buying a motorcycle, with which he could make home deliveries from his grocery store. In this way he could increase his sales, and with better income, he could improve the quality of life of his wife and his two children.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle and offer home delivery service.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a 24-year-old farmer from Yeghnik village who lives with his parents and brothers. His family helps him with his farming and agriculture business. 

Artur dreams of owning a big farm and developing different fields of agriculture. To help make this dream come true, Artur has applied for a loan, which he plans to use by purchasing cattle and forage. Development of cattle-breeding will allow Artur to increase his income and invest it in other types of  agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage for his farming business.

loans.name: Danelbek

texts.en: Danelbek is a 53-year-old entrepreneur from Yerevan. He lives with his wife and daughters. Danelbek runs a little shop where he sells paints for cars. Danelbek has applied for a loan to expand his business by purchasing more paints to sell. An increase in sales will allow Danelbek to earn additional income and invest it in opening a new shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy paints

loans.name: Vilik

texts.en: Vilik is a 42 year old farmer from Kakhtsrashen village. He lives with his wife, who is a teacher at the local school, children and father. Vilik would like to develop cattle-breeding. With the requested loan he plans to purchase calves. This loan will help Vilik to expand his farm and make it more profitable. With increased income Vilik will sustain his family with improved conditions.

loans.use: to pay for calves.

loans.name: Aghavnik

texts.en: Aghavnik lives in Mrganush village with her mother, sister and daughter-in-law. She runs a little shop. To meet the high demand for products in the village during New Year, Aghavnik would like to increase the variety of products she sells. This loan will help Aghavnik to implement this goal, increase the business income and develop it further.

loans.use: to pay for goods for the shop

loans.name: Hripisik

texts.en: Hripsik is a 46 year-old entrepreneur from Yerevan. She runs three fashion salons in different parts of the city. She lives with her son and daughter, who are both students. The current level of income that Hripsik gets is barely enough to pay for her children's education. Therefore, Hripsik has applied for this loan to develop her business. Hripsik plans to purchase more clothing for her salons and increase the sales. This will allow Hripsik to increase her income and ensure a brighter future for her children.

loans.use: to pay for clothing to sell.

loans.name: Karo

texts.en: Karo is a 35 year old entrepreneur from Yerevan. He trades in construction materials. Karo has applied for a loan to develop his business. With the loan's help he plans to purchase more construction materials for his shop. Karo will increase his sales and get more income. This will help him to save money and invest in opening a new shop in the future.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials

loans.name: Areg

texts.en: Areg is 27 years old. He lives in Yerevan with his parents and sister. Areg has been trading mobile phones for four years and now wants to expand his business. With the requested loan Areg plans to purchase mobile phones and increase the variety of his inventory. This loan will help Areg to develop his business and increase his income, which will allow him to start his own family and sustain them in the future.

loans.use: to pay for mobile phones

loans.name: Rassoul

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 20 years old, single and lives with four family members (two of them work).

Rassoul has been an owner of a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products.  He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for an $1,800 loan in order to redecorate his market and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to redecorate his market and add more foodstuffs

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single and lives with four family members.

Mohamad is an owner of a shop since 2007, selling spare parts for cars. He worked with his older brother in car maintenance so he gained sufficient experience in this field. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

Mohamad decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to repair and fix his shop’s walls, floors, and ceiling and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to repair and fix his shop’s walls, floors, and ceiling and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Waed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old and married.

Waed is has owned a workshop for heating and air conditioning repair and services since 2006. He has sufficient experience and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a loan of $2,400 in order to redecorate his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family's quality of life.
